title: U.S. - Infant mortality rate 1990 to 2018
yAxis: Infant mortality rate per thousand live births
summary: In general Infant mortality rate per thousand live births has fallen over the Year.

Infant mortality rate per thousand live births is gradually decreasing from 1995 to 2001, roughly constant from 2001 to 2004, slightly decreasing from 2004 to 2010, roughly constant from 2010 to 2012, and lastly roughly decreasing from 2012 to 2013.
The most drastic decrease took place within the Year 1995 and 1996.
Maximum Infant mortality rate per thousand live births, about 8.0 was reported at Year 1995
Minimum Infant mortality rate per thousand live births about 6.0 was reached at Year 2013
min_summary: Overall Infant mortality rate per thousand live births has decreased over the Year.
